news_header: Scientists have discovered that mummified bodies from ancient Egypt, even after 5,000 years, still emit pleasant smells described as 'woody', 'spicy', and 'sweet'.
news_original_title: Ancient Egyptian mummies still smell nice, study finds
news_text: Researchers aim to recreate these scents for display in the Egyptian Museum in Cairo, highlighting the cultural significance of smells in ancient Egyptian mummification practices. The study, published in the Journal of the American Chemical Society, utilized non-destructive methods to analyze the scents, which may also provide insights into the social class of the mummies and aid in their conservation.
